DOC.brief_title: Influence Beta-glucan Enriched Barley Flour Bread Glycemic Response
DOC.detailed_description: Objective study investigate influence beta-glucan enrich barley flour constituent bread glycaemic response ( GR ) healthy human volunteer . Glycaemic response measure area curve ( AUC ) blood glucose consumption barley bread ( ) , compare AUC white bread . Measurements do line recommendation . In line recommendation ten healthy human volunteer test obtain sufficient statistical power . GR measurement base available carbohydrate . Amount bread standardise contain 50 g available carbohydrate . Subjects consume bread sample 250 mL water , within 10-15 minute . Blood sample time 0 min ( baseline sample ) , follow 15 , 30 , 45 , 60 , 75 , 90 120 min start eat test meal . Glucose level measure capillary blood . For reference test meal , investigator least 2 AUC measurement per subject . AUC calculation base incremental AUC , ignore area baseline . Comparison do mean individual ratio . The difference different product ingest analyzed statistical test analysis variance . In case failure find homogeneity variance nonparametric ANOVA , Kruskal-Wallis test , use . The result express mean Â± standard deviation significance level 0.05 statistical test .
DOC.criteria: Willingness ' participate , selfdiagnosed healthy Age : 1865 year Allergy intolerances ingredient test product ( bread ) Renal impairment Diagnosed diabetes Level glucose 5.6mmol/l first measurement Thyroid disease Use medicine lower blood fat and/or preparation weight loss reduce absorption nutrient digestive tract
